chapters.title: Leo's Space Home
chapters.passage:
Leo was a young boy. He did not live in a house on Earth. He lived in a big space station. It was high above the world. Leo loved his home. It was quiet and very cool. Every morning, Leo woke up and looked out of his round window. He saw the big, blue Earth. He saw the moon. It was white and grey. He saw millions of bright stars. They were very beautiful.

Leo had no brothers or sisters on the station. Sometimes he was lonely. He wanted a friend to play with. He played with his toy cars, but it was not the same. He read books about planets. He ate his space food. But he always went back to the window.

One night, Leo looked at the dark sky. The stars shined like small lights. He counted them. 'One, two, three,' he said. Everything was the same as always. The moon was quiet. The Earth was blue. But then, Leo saw something strange. He looked harder. It was not a star. It was not a planet. It was something different on the moon.
chapters.summary: Leo lives on a space station and looks at the stars, but he feels a bit lonely.

chapters.title: The Red Light
chapters.passage:
Leo ran to get his big telescope. He wanted to see the moon better. He looked through the glass. He saw grey rocks. He saw deep holes. And then, he saw the red light again. Flash. Flash. Flash.

It was not a rock. Rocks do not flash. It was not a star. Stars are white or yellow. This light was red. It went on and off. Leo watched it for a long time. 'What is that?' he asked.

He looked at his book about space codes. He found a page about lights. A flashing red light meant 'Help!' Someone was on the moon. Someone was in trouble. Maybe it was an astronaut. Maybe it was a ship. Leo felt worried. He was only a boy, but he was brave. He looked at the red light. It flashed fast now. 'I must help,' said Leo. 'I must go to the moon.'
chapters.summary: Leo sees a flashing red light on the moon and realizes it is a call for help.

chapters.title: Into the Rocket
chapters.passage:
Leo went to his room. He opened a big cupboard. First, he took out his space suit. It was white and blue. He put on the suit. Zip! Then, he put on his big boots. Stomp! Stomp! Last, he put on his helmet. Click! Now he was ready.

He ran to the garage. His small rocket was there. It was shiny and fast. Leo climbed inside the rocket. He sat in the pilot's seat. There were many buttons. Red buttons, blue buttons, and green buttons. Leo pushed the big green button. The engine started. Vroom! Vroom!

'Computer, ready?' asked Leo.
'Ready,' said the computer.

Leo pulled the handle. The garage door opened. He saw the black space. He saw the moon. It looked very big now. The rocket went up. Whoosh! It flew out of the station. It flew very fast towards the moon.
chapters.summary: Leo puts on his spacesuit and flies his rocket towards the moon.

chapters.title: Walking on the Moon
chapters.passage:
The rocket landed on the moon. Bump! Leo opened the door. He walked down the steps. The moon was different from the space station. It was very quiet. There was no wind. There was only grey dust and grey rocks.

Leo tried to walk. But he did not walk like on Earth. He jumped! On the moon, he was lighter. One small step was a big jump. 'Whee!' cried Leo. He jumped high into the air. He floated down slowly. It was fun. He jumped over small rocks. He jumped over big holes.

But Leo remembered the red light. He had to find it. He looked left. He looked right. He saw many rocks. He walked for a long time. It was cold on the moon. Then, he saw a weak red glow. It was behind a big, black rock. Leo walked carefully. He heard a strange sound. 'Beep... Beep...'
chapters.summary: Leo walks on the moon, jumping high because he is light, and looks for the source of the red light.

chapters.title: The Sad Robot
chapters.passage:
Leo looked behind the big rock. He found the red light. It was on a robot! But it was not a big robot. It was a very small robot. It had a round body and one wheel. It had two long metal arms. On its chest, the red light flashed.

'Hello?' said Leo.

The robot made a sad sound. 'Beep... ooh.'

Leo saw the problem. The robot was stuck. A heavy rock was on its leg. The robot could not move. The robot tried to pull its leg, but the rock was too heavy. The robot was scared. Its battery was low. The red light meant 'Low Battery'.

'Do not worry,' said Leo kindly. 'I am Leo. I can help you.'

The robot looked at Leo. Its eyes were blue screens. They blinked. The robot stopped crying. It knew Leo was a friend.
chapters.summary: Leo finds a small robot trapped under a heavy rock and promises to help.

chapters.title: Leo the Strong
chapters.passage:
Leo looked at the heavy rock. He was a small boy, but he was strong in his space suit. And on the moon, things were lighter. 'One, two, three... push!' said Leo. He pushed the rock with his hands. It moved a little bit. He pushed again. 'Ughhh!' The rock rolled away.

The robot was free! It waved its arms. 'Beep! Beep!' it said happily. But the robot could not move fast. Its battery was very low. The red light flashed slowly now.

Leo opened a pocket on his suit. He took out a cable. He connected the cable to the robot. He gave the robot some power from his suit. The robot's eyes got brighter. But now Leo felt tired. His suit had less power. He walked slower. 'We must go to the rocket,' said Leo. 'I am tired and hungry.'
chapters.summary: Leo moves the rock to free the robot and shares his power, but he gets tired.

chapters.title: Flying Home
chapters.passage:
Leo and the robot walked back to the rocket. Leo walked slowly because he was tired. The robot rolled next to him. 'Beep beep,' said the robot. It wanted to say 'Thank you'.

They found the rocket. Leo picked up the small robot. He carried it up the steps. Inside, Leo put the robot on a spare seat. He put a seatbelt on the robot. Click! 'Now you are safe,' said Leo.

Leo sat in the pilot's seat. He pushed the green button again. Vroom! The rocket went up. It left the moon. They flew through the dark space. They saw the big space station. It looked like a shining star. Leo smiled. He was happy to go home. He was happy he had a friend.
chapters.summary: Leo and the robot fly back to the space station together.

chapters.title: A New Best Friend
chapters.passage:
They arrived at the space station. Leo gave the robot a lot of power. The robot was full of energy now! It rolled around the room very fast. 'Zoom! Zoom!'

'What is your name?' asked Leo.
The robot pointed to the sound it made. 'Beep.'
'I will call you Beep,' said Leo. 'I am Leo.'
'Beep!' said the robot happily.

Now, Leo is not lonely. He has a best friend. Beep helps Leo. Beep cleans the room. Beep plays games with Leo. They look at the stars together. The space station is not quiet anymore. It is full of fun noises. Leo loves his home, and he loves his robot friend, Beep.
chapters.summary: Leo names the robot Beep and they become best friends, so Leo is not lonely anymore.
